How to Install icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall icingaweb2-module-monitoring in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install icingaweb2-module-monitoring, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install icingaweb2-module-monitoring Using apt

To install icingaweb2-module-monitoring in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install icingaweb2-module-monitoring using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install icingaweb2-module-monitoring

The installation of icingaweb2-module-monitoring might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install icingaweb2-module-monitoring Using apt-get

To install icingaweb2-module-monitoring using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

sudo apt-get -y install icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Install icingaweb2-module-monitoring Using Synaptic

To install icingaweb2-module-monitoring using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install icingaweb2-module-monitoring on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for icingaweb2-module-monitoring. This will display the icingaweb2-module-monitoring package in the package window, now to install icingaweb2-module-monitoring, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the icingaweb2-module-monitoring package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install icingaweb2-module-monitoring Using aptitude

To install icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install icingaweb2-module-monitoring using the command aptitude install icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

sudo aptitude -y install icingaweb2-module-monitoring

How to Upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian

If you want to upgrade the icingaweb2-module-monitoring package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using Aptitude

To upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using Synaptic

To upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for icingaweb2-module-monitoring, now right-click icingaweb2-module-monitoring, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall icingaweb2-module-monitoring from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just icingaweb2-module-monitoring, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of icingaweb2-module-monitoring

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of icingaweb2-module-monitoring you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge icingaweb2-module-monitoring

Remove icingaweb2-module-monitoring using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall icingaweb2-module-monitoring using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for icingaweb2-module-monitoring, right-click the icingaweb2-module-monitoring package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall icingaweb2-module-monitoring click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install icingaweb2-module-monitoring on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade icingaweb2-module-monitoring using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of icingaweb2-module-monitoring then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
